data.title: Women in Westminster
data.text:
The annual celebration of inspirational and influential women in Westminster is back!

Women in Westminster: The 100 celebrates the achievements and the valuable role women play in public life by recognising one hundred women from across the world of Westminster, who are leading the way in politics and public services, from parliamentarians, journalists, and civil servants to activists, think tankers, public affairs professionals and beyond.

Our board of Patrons, who have expertise and experience across Westminster, select one hundred women from a wide range of nominations, who have demonstrated over the past year that they are not only influential in their own field, but possess the talent and platform to inspire the next generation to make a difference.

Our board of Patrons have recognised one hundred women from across the world of Westminster, who have demonstrated over the past year that they are not only influential in their own field but possess the talent and platform to inspire the next generation to make a difference.

We are delighted to be supporting Women in Westminster: The 100 once again. This is an opportunity to recognise women who are at the top of their game and who are making sure strong female voices are being heard in the corridors of power. They are also role models for the next generation of female leaders and by showcasing their achievements, we can help those young women fulfil their potential too.

â€” Sharon Doherty, Chief People and Places Officer
